name: vscode-mcp-proxy
description: VSCode extension with IPC server for MCP proxying

languageModelTools.name: rename_file
languageModelTools.userDescription: Rename a file and update all imports
languageModelTools.modelDescription: Renames a file or directory from `oldUri` to `newUri`. This tool automatically updates all import statements in the workspace that reference the moved file. Use this when the user asks to move or rename a file.

languageModelTools.name: rename_symbol
languageModelTools.userDescription: Rename a symbol and update all references
languageModelTools.modelDescription: Renames a symbol (function, class, variable, etc.) at the specified `fileUri` and `originalName` to `newName`. This tool uses VS Code's refactoring capabilities to update all references to the symbol across the workspace. Use this when the user asks to rename a variable or function.

fileUri.description: The file URI containing the symbol

originalName.description: The current name of the symbol

newName.description: The new name for the symbol

languageModelTools.name: get_setting
languageModelTools.userDescription: Get a workspace or user configuration setting
languageModelTools.modelDescription: Retrieves the value of a VS Code configuration setting identified by `key`. Can optionally specify a `scope` ('user' or 'workspace'). Use this to check the current configuration of the editor or extension.

languageModelTools.name: set_setting
languageModelTools.userDescription: Set a workspace or user configuration setting
languageModelTools.modelDescription: Updates a VS Code configuration setting identified by `key` to the specified `value`. Can optionally specify a `scope` ('user' or 'workspace'). Use this when the user asks to change an editor setting or extension configuration.

vscode-mcp-proxy.enableHttpServer.description: Enable the HTTP MCP server for external clients (e.g., VSCodium, fastmcp). When enabled, tools will be accessible via HTTP on the configured port.

vscode-mcp-proxy.httpPort.description: Port for the HTTP MCP server. Use 0 for a random available port, or specify a port number between 1-65535.

scripts.pretest: yarn run compile && yarn run lint
